qas.question: Who built the first electric elevator?
The first electric elevator, built in 1880, was in what Country?
Who ultilized von Siemens ideas to build a succesful business?
Who is credited with increasing the safety and speed of electric elevators?
To whom did Frank Sprague sell his company to in 1895?

context: The first electric elevator was built by <a0_0>Werner von Siemens<a0_0/> in 1880 in <a1_0>Germany<a1_0/>. The inventor <a2_0>Anton Freissler<a2_0/> developed the ideas of von Siemens and built up a successful enterprise in Austria-Hungary. The safety and speed of electric elevators were significantly enhanced by <a3_0>Frank Sprague<a3_0/> who added floor control, automatic elevators, acceleration control of cars, and safeties. His elevator ran faster and with larger loads than hydraulic or steam elevators, and 584 electric elevators were installed before Sprague sold his company to the <a4_0>Otis Elevator Company<a4_0/> in 1895. Sprague also developed the idea and technology for multiple elevators in a single shaft.
